title: No item sets in the new LoL client beta?
body: I can't find where to make item sets anywhere in the client. Am I blind or do they just not exist anymore?

replies.body: yeah where the fuck are they!?!?!?
Rito has told us there will no longer be item sets due to the fact that only a small number of players have used it

Really? Riot shouldn't do that, they should 'provide' all options for players and let them decide whether to use them or not. If they keep it, those who don't use it don't lose anything and the people who do use it can gain from it. If they remove it those who don't use it don't lose anything but the people who do lose out. There's literally no downside from keeping it and no upside from removing it.
Fuck rip they are handy when learning a new champ and not having to think as much about what to build.
Well that's pretty depressing. I don't remember any of the items I need for my champs... Really stupid that they took it off.

It one of those Soon TM kinda deals. They'll be there eventually, but they're a lower priority than things like keeping the new ranked queues stable, RGM queue, spectate and various other high profile features that have yet to be implemented.

but... but... now the recommended pages are like, yeah we replaced vision wards with control wards, but control wards are useless so we won't recommend you bother buying them, so they're not on the recommended items pages.

I can't deny the recommended pages don't always hit the mark. You can still use any item sets you create in the legacy client in the meantime, which you can switch back to from the login page (though a few people do appear to be having issues with this).
I'm on mac client and I physically cannot go back to the legacy client. It just doesn't work. I click on the link, it launches, and then it forces me to go into the beta client. RIP my builds.
Apparently hardly anyone uses them so they're a lot further down on the priority list for now

wait, ad support?
yeah, champs that have ad as their main stat but play support occasionally. If Support MF worked at Worlds, why not make an AD support build for others?

I use them, judging from your reaction you use them... but we are not everyone... it's a simple function that has no major baring on the game itself so it makes sense it's really low on priority to set up, from what I've read it will get moved over eventually... but all the other new things and stability of the new client are far more important...  I mean, built in replay functions... seriously stop complaining when they are finally getting us something most of us have been asking for... since day one...
